newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish government says no plan yet to sell Telia.
newsitem.headline: Swedish government says no plan yet to sell Telia.

text.p: The Swedish government said on Thursday that it had not yet decided whether or not to privatise Sweden's national telephone operator Telia.

"Telia has no immediate need for a capital injection and I don't see any reason to have a timetable for a possible privatisation," Transport & Communications Minister Ines Uusmann told a news conference.

But business daily Dagens Industri said on February 19 that the company needed a capital injection of 5-10 billion crowns to realise its plans to expand abroad and to compensate for price falls due to stronger competition and new technology.
In December 1996, Uusmann dismissed the idea of listing Telia, but lately she has said Telia should have the same conditions as other European telephone operators active in the same markets.
Many of those operators are listed or about to become listed.
